amendment.description: To phase out the authority of the Export-Import Bank of the United States and to require the President to initiate negotiations with other major exporting countries to end subsidized export financing programs.

vote.text: Amendment SA 2100, under the order of 5/14/2012, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 12 - 86. Record Vote Number: 91.

action.text: Amendment SA 2100 proposed by Senator Lee. (consideration: CR S3146-3148, S3155; text: CR S3146) To phase out the authority of the Export-Import Bank of the United States and to require the President to initiate negotiations with other major exporting countries to end subsidized export financing programs.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 2100 proposed by Senator Lee.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 2100, under the order of 5/14/2012, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 12 - 86. Record Vote Number: 91.

Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 2100, under the order of 5/14/2012, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 12 - 86. Record Vote Number: 91.
